answer: Machine learning is a subset of AI that enables computers to learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed.
Neural networks are computing systems inspired by biological neurons that process information through interconnected nodes.
Supervised learning uses labeled data for training, while unsupervised learning finds patterns in unlabeled data.
Backpropagation is an algorithm that calculates gradients of the loss function with respect to network weights.
Activation functions introduce non-linearity into neural networks, enabling them to learn complex patterns.
Overfitting can be prevented through regularization, cross-validation, and using more training data.
Deep learning uses multiple layers of neural networks to learn hierarchical representations of data.
Gradient descent is an optimization algorithm that minimizes loss by updating parameters in the direction of steepest descent.
Bias terms allow neural networks to shift the activation function, improving model flexibility.
CNNs use convolutional layers to automatically learn spatial hierarchies of features from input data.
Transfer learning is a technique where a model trained on one task is adapted for a related task, improving performance and reducing training time.
